definitions: light-colored beer fermented at low temperatures for extended periods
examples: He ordered a cold lager from the German brewery
The pub serves several varieties of imported lagers

definitions: protective covering that prevents heat loss from pipes or equipment
examples: The maintenance crew installed new lagging around the steam pipes
Old lagging containing asbestos needs careful removal

definitions: body of water separated from larger sea by coral reef or sandbar
examples: The tropical resort overlooked a beautiful turquoise lagoon
Small boats anchored in the lagoon protected from ocean waves

definitions: place where wild animal rests or sleeps, especially predator's den
examples: The wolf returned to its lair deep in the forest
They discovered the bear's lair hidden among the rocks

definitions: land area along the edge of a lake, often developed for recreation
examples: Their lakefront cottage offered stunning views of the water
The city developed a public park along the entire lakefront

definitions: land immediately bordering a lake where water meets the shore
examples: Children played along the sandy lakeshore all afternoon
The hiking trail follows the lakeshore for several miles

definitions: location or area situated next to or near a lake
examples: The lakeside restaurant serves fresh fish caught daily
They enjoyed a peaceful picnic at the lakeside park

definitions: spiritual teacher or monk in Tibetan Buddhism who guides religious practice
examples: The young monks studied meditation under the guidance of their lama
The Dalai Lama is the most widely known Tibetan Buddhist lama

definitions: sheep less than one year old with soft wool
tender meat from a young sheep used for cooking
examples: The spring lamb frolicked in the meadow with its mother
Newborn lambs need protection from cold weather and predators
She prepared roasted lamb with herbs for the special dinner
The restaurant specializes in grilled lamb chops and Mediterranean sides

definitions: eleventh letter of Greek alphabet used in mathematics and science
examples: The physics equation used lambda to represent the wavelength
In calculus, lambda often denotes an eigenvalue

definitions: passionate expression of grief or sorrow through words or sounds
examples: Her lament for the lost sailors moved everyone to tears
The poet's lament captured the nation's grief perfectly

definitions: expression of deep sorrow, regret, or mourning through crying or wailing
examples: The lamentation at the funeral could be heard throughout the village
Ancient texts contain many lamentations for fallen heroes

definitions: manufactured material made by bonding together two or more layers
examples: The kitchen counters were covered with durable laminate surfaces
She chose wood-grain laminate flooring for the renovation project

definitions: harsh satire ridiculing someone or something through exaggerated humor
examples: The magazine published a lampoon of the politician's policies
His lampoon of corporate culture became an overnight sensation

definitions: jawless fish with round sucker mouth that attaches to other fish
examples: The lamprey attached itself to the side of the salmon
Scientists study lampreys to understand primitive vertebrate evolution

definitions: roofed outdoor living area typical of Hawaiian architecture, similar to veranda
examples: They enjoyed breakfast on the lanai overlooking the garden
The house features a spacious lanai perfect for entertaining

definitions: long wooden shaft with pointed metal head used by mounted warriors
examples: The medieval knight charged forward with his lance lowered
Tournament participants practiced with blunted lances for safety

definitions: mounted soldier armed with a lance in historical military units
examples: The Polish lancers were famous for their battlefield courage
Museum displays showed the uniform of a 19th century lancer

definitions: small sharp-pointed surgical knife used for making incisions
examples: The doctor used a sterile lancet to obtain a blood sample
Diabetics often use lancets to check their blood sugar levels

definitions: spacecraft designed to land on celestial body and conduct surface operations
examples: The Mars lander transmitted valuable data back to Earth
Engineers tested the moon lander in simulated lunar conditions

definitions: event when tropical storm or hurricane center crosses from sea onto land
examples: The hurricane made landfall near the coastal city at midnight
Residents evacuated before the storm's predicted landfall

definitions: designated area where garbage is buried between layers of earth
examples: The city diverted recyclables away from the overcrowded landfill
Modern landfills use liners to prevent groundwater contamination

definitions: person who owns or controls land, especially large estates
examples: The wealthy landholder owned thousands of acres of farmland
Small landholders struggled to compete with corporate farms

definitions: area of land owned or held by individual or organization
examples: His landholding included several farms and a forest preserve
The family's landholding had been passed down for generations

definitions: woman who owns and rents out property to tenants
examples: The landlady collected rent on the first of each month
Their elderly landlady lived in the apartment downstairs

definitions: traditional telephone service connected through physical wires to building
examples: Many households still keep a landline for emergency calls
The office landline rang constantly during business hours

definitions: person who owns property and rents it to tenants
examples: The landlord agreed to fix the broken heating system
She negotiated with her landlord for a lower monthly rent

definitions: prominent object or feature that serves as guide or point of reference
event or discovery marking important stage in development
examples: The old lighthouse serves as a landmark for sailors
Tourist maps highlighted all the major landmarks in the city
The court's decision became a landmark in civil rights history
Her research represented a landmark achievement in cancer treatment

definitions: person who has legal ownership of land or real estate
examples: The landowner decided to develop part of the property
Local landowners met to discuss the proposed highway route

definitions: activity of designing and maintaining attractive grounds with plants and features
examples: Professional landscaping transformed their plain yard into a garden paradise
The new office building included extensive landscaping around the entrance

definitions: rapid downward movement of rock and soil down a slope
election victory by an overwhelming margin
examples: Heavy rains triggered a landslide that blocked the mountain road
The landslide destroyed several homes at the base of the hill
The incumbent won by a landslide with 70% of votes
Political analysts predicted a landslide victory for the popular candidate

definitions: person unfamiliar with the sea or inexperienced in seamanship
examples: The experienced sailors laughed at the clumsy landsman's attempts
As a landsman, he felt seasick during his first ocean voyage

definitions: lamp with protective transparent case designed to be carried
examples: Campers hung the lantern from a tree branch for light
The old lighthouse keeper carried his lantern up the stairs

definitions: cord worn around neck to hold identification badge or keys
examples: Employees must wear their ID badges on the company lanyard
She attached her whistle to a lanyard for easy access

definitions: folded flap on each side of coat or jacket front
examples: He pinned the boutonniere to his suit jacket's lapel
The tailor adjusted the lapels for a perfect fit

definitions: technique of laying materials with overlapping edges
gentle splashing sound of water against shore
examples: The roof tiles required proper lapping to prevent leaks
Correct lapping of shingles ensures water runs off properly
The lapping of waves against the dock was soothing
She fell asleep listening to the gentle lapping sounds

definitions: brief failure of concentration, memory, or judgment
interval of time passing between events
examples: His lapse in attention caused him to miss the turn
A momentary lapse of judgment led to the accident
After a lapse of several years, they finally reunited
The insurance policy expired after a lapse in payments

definitions: unlawful taking of personal property with intent to deprive owner
examples: The suspect was charged with grand larceny for stealing the car
Petty larceny involves theft of items worth less than $1000

definitions: tall conifer that sheds its needles in winter unlike most evergreens
examples: The golden larch needles created a beautiful autumn display
Larch wood is prized for its durability and resistance

definitions: white semisolid fat obtained from pigs used in cooking
examples: Traditional pie crusts were made with lard for flakiness
She substituted vegetable shortening for lard in the recipe

definitions: cool room or large cupboard for storing food provisions
examples: The cook checked the larder for ingredients needed for dinner
Their well-stocked larder contained preserves and canned goods

definitions: popular freshwater game fish with large mouth extending past eyes
examples: The angler caught a trophy largemouth in the lake
Largemouth bass prefer warm water with plenty of vegetation

definitions: long rope with running noose used for catching livestock
examples: The cowboy expertly threw his lariat around the calf's neck
She practiced twirling the lariat in wide circles overhead

definitions: small ground-dwelling songbird known for melodious song
carefree adventure or amusing activity done for fun
examples: The meadow lark's song announced the arrival of spring
Skylarks sing while flying high in the morning sky
They went on a lark to the beach instead of studying
What started as a lark turned into a serious hobby

definitions: juvenile form of insect that undergoes metamorphosis to become adult
examples: The butterfly larva fed on milkweed leaves before pupating
Mosquito larvae develop in standing water before emerging

definitions: organ in throat containing vocal cords that produces sound
examples: The singer strained her larynx from overuse during performances
The doctor examined his larynx to diagnose the hoarseness

definitions: leather strip or cord at end of whip
one of the short hairs growing from eyelids
examples: The rider's lash cracked loudly in the air
The whip's lash left marks on the horse's flank
She applied mascara to darken her lashes
A stray lash had fallen into her eye
